ygData.subject: Re: {Disarmed} Re: [rest-discuss] Interface for non-idempotent fetch?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Errr.. you still get the data. And you re not doing a fetch, are you? You re doing an implicit update of a sequence. -- Nic Ferrier

Keith Gaughan <keith@...> writes:

> Nic James Ferrier wrote:
>
>> Applying the razor to this question leads me to ask:
>> 
>>    why can't you just use POST?
>> 
>> For example:
>> 
>>    POST /numbers/FOO/next
>>    => 1
>> 
>>    POST /numbers/FOO/next
>>    => 2
>> 
>>    POST /numbers/BAR/next
>>    => 1
>
> That's not really a fetch then, is it?

Errr.. you still get the data.

And you're not doing a fetch, are you? You're doing an implicit
update of a sequence.

-- 
Nic Ferrier
http://www.tapsellferrier.co.uk
